channel.title: picture this
channel.description: in ep 3 after you manage to destroy borealis, you get a message saying that the borealis was a trap. the combine have managed to gather together every force on earth and are attac king your possition. you walk over a hill and the second you see the other side, you se a huge army of combine ships and synths approaching. you take a flaregun and shoots it up in the air and a huge army of humans come from behind and a masive battle takes place with gordon having a new kind of gravity gun that is more powerfull XD

item.title: picture this
item.dc:creator: ulvemann43
item.description:
Master Chef:

Personally, I think VALVe really fucked up the Half-Life Universe in HL2 by making it a bastard mix of Terminator and Star Wars. The only way to make it worse would be by adding said generic epic battle that would end up being a total shit fest. On the topic of huge armies of humans, you have to realize that there is no army and practically 80% of the population is dead.

/thread/

if you wan’t to, you can se over a million rebels get killed in hl2 XD.
and don’t forget about xen. or maybe other enslaved combine species with rebel parts in it to

Read full topic

item.title: picture this
item.dc:creator: ulvemann43
item.description:
Sky Monster:

I really like the idea of a sort of, epic battle sideshow, but not to MAKE you watch it. More like the Call of Duty 2 style, with it going on in the background in the distance.

[Slightly Off-Topic] It seems that VALVe made Episode 2 have much more defined difficulty settings, as opposed to HL2 being retardedly easy (yes, I said easy, if you found it hard you’ve never played HL1 on hard)

hl1 on hard was brutal. hl2 on hard is like hl1 on easy XD.
smod on the othe side… it would be cool if one part of the battle were in the real map and annother part was with skybox props and npcs so the battle can be larger XD

Read full topic

item.description:
Right4Dead:

Seems like another one of those lazy Call of Duty ideas.
I like the fact that all of the fights were more guerilla like, instead of sitting in a trench for three hours shooting at enemy soldiers that spawn for three hours.
